messages.subject: Why I make my son eat bread crust
messages.msgSnippet: Well, it s fine if ds doesn t like bread crust, but we really are VERY poor and are lucky to have enough to eat at all.  That s why he must eat the crust.  We
messages.messageBody:
Well, it's fine if ds doesn't like bread crust, but we really are VERY
poor and are lucky to have enough to eat at all. That's why he must
eat the crust. We just can't afford to waste it. (That's also why
we're looking for a job in the states...) BTW, he loves ALL his
vegetables (even cabbage and broccoli!) except spinach and green
peppers and he will eat those if I chop them up really small and hide
them in other foods. When he was younger, I'd dry out the bread crusts
in the freezer and the next day I'd pour milk on it like cereal. He
used to love it. Now he prefers it with the rest of the bread. He
doesn't like it, but he understands we don't waste food.

NEways...

Love, Melanie in Japan
